Authors:
Dhandevi Pem, Rajesh Jeewon, Erio Camporesi, Sinang
Hongsanan, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Molecular taxonomy of new Valsaria species and phylogeny
significance of ornamentation in species taxonomy
Keywords:
new taxa  ascomycetous fungi  Italy  multigene phylogeny 
taxonomy 
Abstract:
During our fungal diversity studies on ascomycetes from
plant substrates, a new Valsaria species was isolated from dead branches
of Ostrya carpinifolia. The taxon is morphologically similar to other
known taxa in Valsariaceae and is characterized by pseudostromatic
stromata, apically free paraphyses, bitunicate asci and dark brown
2-celled ascospores. However it differs from extant species in terms of
number of guttules and spore ornamentation. It is introduced herein as
Valsaria ostryae. sp. nov. within the family Valsariaceae. Multigene
phylogenies based on LSU, ITS and rpb2 sequence data generated from
maximum likelihood, maximum parsimony and MrBayes analyses indicate that
V.ostryae forms an independent lineage and nested in between V.
lopadostomoides and V.neotropica and its establishment as a new species
is strongly supported. No discordance was found between our
morphological and phylogenetic species boundaries as postulated by other
researchers but our molecular data strongly supports spore ornamentation
as a phylogenetically informative character useful for species
delineation.
